text.0: born like a youngling he hath clamoured in the wood when he the red the strong would win the light of heaven.
text.1: he comes with heavenly seed that makes the water swell him for widespreading shelter we implore with prayer.
text.2: a farextended pillar that supports the sky the somastalk filled full moves itself every way.
text.3: he shall bring both these great worlds while the rite proceeds the sage holds these who move together and all food.
text.4: wide space hath he who follows aditis right path and mighty wellmade food meath blent with soma juice.
text.5: he who from hence commands the rain steer of the kine leader of floods who helps us hence who claims our laud.
text.6: butter and milk are drawn from animated cloud thence amṛta is produced centre of sacrifice.
text.7: hini the most bounteous ones ever united love him as ouir friend the men who make all swell rain down.
text.8: the somastalk hath roared following with the wave he swells with sap for man the skin which gods enjoy.
text.9: upon the lap of aditi he lays the germ by means whereof we gain children and progeny.
text.10: in the third region which distils a thousand streams may the exhaustless ones descend with procreant power.
text.11: the kindred four have been sent downward from the heavens dropping with oil they bring amṛta and sacred gifts.
text.12: soma assumes white colour when he strives to gain the bounteous asura knows full many a precious boon.
text.13: down the steep slope through song he comes to sacrifice and he will burst the waterholding cask of heaven.
text.14: yea to the shining milkanointed beaker as to his goal hath stepped the conquering courser.
text.15: pioussouled men have sent their giffi of cattle unto kakṣīvān of the hundred winters.
text.16: soma thy juice when thou art blended with the streams flows pavamana through the long wool of the sheep.
text.17: so cleansed by sages o best giver of delight grow sweet for indra pavamana for his drink.
